summary: This document is a summary of a call with William Brown, a DMV investigator, regarding DMV procedures for obtaining identification cards and driver's licenses, particularly the verification process and document requirements. The call appears to be part of an investigation, as indicated by the reference to sending photos associated with an application and the protective order notice.

persons.name: William Brown
persons.context: A DMV investigator with 20 years of experience who supervises investigations and other investigators; discussed DMV procedures for ID verification and agreed to send photos related to an application.

events.title: Investigation Call with DMV
events.description: A call was conducted with William Brown, a DMV supervising investigator, to discuss DMV procedures for issuing identification cards and driver's licenses, including verification processes and document requirements.

keyFacts: William Brown, a DMV supervising investigator with 20 years of experience, detailed the DMV's process for verifying identity documents (name, DOB, Social Security card, proof of residency) and issuing ID cards and driver's licenses.
The DMV destroys original application records, so they cannot confirm what specific documents were provided at the time of an application, only the types of IDs that would have been accepted.
Brown agreed to send the photos associated with a specific DMV application, indicating this information is relevant to an ongoing investigation, as noted by the 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' warning.
